Class SlideGame1

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • java.awt.Window
          • java.awt.Frame
            • javax.swing.JFrame
              • SlideGame1
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants

    public class SlideGame1
extends javax.swing.JFrame
implements java.awt.event.ActionListener
    An improved version of the popular game, "2048." Improvements include a reset button, a game title, motivational support and diagonal movement.
    Author:
    Jacob Alspaw
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • SlideGame1

        public SlideGame1(int rows,
                  int columns)
        Constructor for the SlideGame. This constructor will set up the game to the designated amount of rows and columns and initialize the game.
        Parameters:
        rows - the number rows in the game.
        columns - the number of columns in the game.

    • Method Detail

      • resetGame

        public void resetGame()
        Resets the game back to the original starting point of two tiles. Is used when the reset button is activated. No parameters or return values are used.

      • addValueToJButtons

        public void addValueToJButtons()
        This method rewrites the values on the JButton array. The values on the board will change as a result. Buttons with "0' as a value are changed to have no text in the grid. Different colors are assigned to buttons of different values. No parameters or return values are used.

      • addNewTile

        public void addNewTile()
        This method adds a new value to the int array at a randomly chosen location. The location is the place of a current zero value and the tile added is always of value "1". No parameters or return values are used.

      • setColumns

        public void setColumns(int numberColumns)
        Sets the number of columns.
        Parameters:
        numberColumns - is the number of columns.

      • setRows

        public void setRows(int numberRows)
        Sets the number of rows.
        Parameters:
        numberRows - is the number of rows.

      • actionPerformed

        public void actionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent e)
        This method listens for actions performed. Specifically, this method will act on the press of the reset button or the press of designated buttons on the grid. The press of the reset button completely resets the game. The press of the grid buttons will manipulate the array in the correct direction using the sliding methods. The motivational text is changed and a new tile is added. If the game has been won, then the buttons will not work. There is no return value.
        Specified by:
        actionPerformed in interface java.awt.event.ActionListener
        Parameters:
        e - is the event performed.

      • isOnGrid

        public static boolean isOnGrid(int[][] array,
                               int a,
                               int b)
        Tests if the current tile is on the grid.
        Parameters:
        array - is being tested.
        a - is the row of the tile.
        b - is the column of the tile.
        Returns:
        boolean

      • isCorner

        public static boolean isCorner(int[][] array,
                               int a,
                               int b)
        Tests if the tile is the top left or bottom right tile.
        Parameters:
        array - is being tested.
        a - is the row of the tile.
        b - is the column of the tile.
        Returns:
        boolean

      • slideLeft

        public static boolean slideLeft(int[][] array,
                                int row)
        This method manipulates an array in the desiganted row. The values in the row are moved all the way left of the row as possible. If the next value is equal to the current value, the two combine into double their previous value. If the next value isn't equal to the current vlue, the value before acts as a wall and stops the sliding value.
        Parameters:
        array - stores the values for the game.
        row - is the designated row to slide.
        Returns:
        boolean

      • slideRight

        public static boolean slideRight(int[][] array,
                                 int row)
        This method manipulates an array in the desiganted row. The values in the row are moved all the way right of the row as possible. If the next value is equal to the current value, the two combine into double their previous value. If the next value isn't equal to the current vlue, the value before acts as a wall and stops the sliding value.
        Parameters:
        array - stores the values for the game.
        row - is the designated row to slide.
        Returns:
        boolean

      • slideUp

        public static boolean slideUp(int[][] array,
                              int column)
        This method manipulates an array in the desiganted column. The values in the column are moved all the way up the row as possible. If the next value is equal to the current value, the two combine into double their previous value. If the next value isn't equal to the current vlue, the value before acts as a wall and stops the sliding value.
        Parameters:
        array - stores the values for the game.
        column - is the designated column to slide.
        Returns:
        boolean

      • slideDown

        public static boolean slideDown(int[][] array,
                                int column)
        This method manipulates an array in the desiganted column. The values in the column are moved all the way down the row as possible. If the next value is equal to the current value, the two combine into double their previous value. If the next value isn't equal to the current vlue, the value before acts as a wall and stops the sliding value.
        Parameters:
        array - stores the values for the game.
        column - is the designated column to slide.
        Returns:
        boolean

      • slideUpLeft

        public static boolean slideUpLeft(int[][] array,
                                  int row,
                                  int column)
        This method manipulates an array in the desiganted column. The values in the column are moved all the way across the diagonal as possible. If the next value is equal to the current value, the two combine into double their previous value. If the next value isn't equal to the current vlue, the value before acts as a wall and stops the sliding value.
        Parameters:
        array - stores the values for the game.
        row - is the designated row to slide.
        column - is the designated column to slide.
        Returns:
        boolean

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        This is the main method. It quickly initializes the game. The default is set to a game of 4 rows and 4 columns. Throwing two numbers will give a different number of rows and columns. There is no return value.
        Parameters:
        args - is a string array that holds the place of the dimensions.
